layout.container: min-h-screen w-full flex flex-col items-center justify-center overflow-hidden relative p-4
layout.card: relative z-10 max-w-md w-full text-center p-8 md:p-12 rounded-3xl backdrop-blur-xl bg-white/40 border border-white/60 shadow-[0_8px_32px_rgba(255,77,109,0.15)]
layout.button_group: flex flex-col md:flex-row gap-6 items-center justify-center mt-12 h-32 relative

buttons.base: rounded-full px-8 py-4 text-xl font-bold transition-all duration-300 shadow-lg hover:shadow-xl active:scale-95
buttons.yes: bg-gradient-to-r from-[#FF4D6D] to-[#C9184A] text-white hover:scale-110 animate-pulse-slow
buttons.no: bg-white text-[#C9184A] border-2 border-[#FF4D6D] hover:bg-[#FFF0F3] absolute transition-all duration-100 ease-out

animations.dodge: Use framer-motion to randomly change x/y coordinates on hover/click for the 'No' button. Ensure it stays within viewport bounds but moves away from cursor.
animations.celebration: Trigger canvas-confetti on 'Yes' click. Show a full-screen overlay with success message.

implementation_steps.description: Setup Tailwind config with new colors and fonts. Import fonts in index.css.
Create the 'ProposalCard' component. Use the glassmorphism style. Add the 'Will you be my Valentine?' text using Dancing Script.
Implement the 'Yes' button. It should be static in the center-left of the button group.

Implement the 'No' button using Framer Motion. Add 'onHoverStart' and 'onClick' handlers to trigger a random x/y offset. It must be absolutely positioned within the relative button group container initially, then move freely.
Create the 'SuccessView' component. This replaces the card content when 'Yes' is clicked. Show the 'hero_bear' image and a romantic message.
Integrate 'canvas-confetti' to fire when 'Yes' is clicked.

universal_guidelines: Do not use generic red (#FF0000). Use the provided palette.
Ensure the 'No' button is actually clickable if the user is extremely fast (optional easter egg), but primarily it should dodge.
Mobile responsiveness: Ensure the 'No' button doesn't fly off-screen on small devices. Calculate bounds based on window.innerWidth/Height.
Use 'sonner' for any toast messages if needed (e.g., 'Nice try!' if they manage to click No).
